description.narrative: Givargemensam fond för stöd till civila samhället med fokus på demokrati, mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet.
Joint donor fund for support to civil society with focus on democracy, human rights and gender equality.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
DGF implements the programme through a large number of NGOs and some state actors. It is hard to keep track of all of them, but the impression in general is that most of the partners deliver according to plan. The Steering Committee of the DGF made a joint field visit to Gulu in May. A total of six partners were visited. The partners, although to very different extents, provided interesting insights into the work of the organisations. It became clear throughout the visit that many of the partners’ activities directly or indirectly overlapped. There is great potential for collaboration, not just amongst DGF partners but also between DGF partners and other RDE partners, as evidenced by the informal cooperation between some of the partners. The narrative reporting on results has not been submitted yet, why it is hard to reflect results so far. Most of the available data is output based until the report, which should be more analytical, has been finalised. These outputs indicate that there is progress within all areas of intervention. The records show that over 750,000 individuals have been involved in DGF supported events. A few examples of activities: - Close to 500 issue-based initiatives to influence the legislative or policy frameworks have been made, including progress on gender related legislation. - There are over 2,700 examples of inputs from citizen or CSOs that have been taken on board by elected representatives. - More than 900 public forums have been held where government/state institution representatives interact with the citizens and/or CSOs to inffluence a legislation and/or policy framework. - 245 conflict prevention, peace building and transitional justice events have been conducted. - Over 4,300 torture victimes have been assisted. - 90 studies on governance have been issued. - Over 93,000 legal aid cases have been started and resolved. This gives only a very general overview and does not give any indication of impact. The report will hopefully give more insights in the more substantial results.
FYLL PÅ!
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
